problems.title: Find Peak Element using Binary Search
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an array of N integers where arr[i] != arr[i+1] for all valid i.
A peak element is an element that is strictly greater than its neighbors.
Find ANY peak element and return its index using Binary Search.

Note: arr[-1] = arr[n] = negative infinity (boundary elements can be peaks).
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
1 2 3 1 0

Sample Output
2

Explanation:
Element at index 2 is 3, which is greater than neighbors 2 and 1. So 3 is a peak.
problems.constraints:
1 <= N <= 1000
-10000 <= arr[i] <= 10000
arr[i] != arr[i+1] for all valid i
